_meta.source: Researched from TripAdvisor, Cruise Critic, Alaska.org, and local guides

bbox_hint.note: Covers downtown Ketchikan, totem parks, and Misty Fjords

transit_routes.name: Saxman Totem Park Shuttle
transit_routes.note: Includes cultural program option. Tours run frequently from cruise pier.

transit_routes.name: Totem Bight Shuttle/Taxi
transit_routes.note: 10 miles north. Can combine with Potlatch Park. Budget option: city bus $2.

transit_routes.name: Misty Fjords Flightseeing
transit_routes.note: Floatplanes depart from downtown harbor. Weather dependent — have backup plan.

transit_routes.name: Walking Tour
transit_routes.duration: 10 min to Creek Street, 15 min to Heritage Center
transit_routes.note: Downtown core entirely walkable. Lumberjack show at cruise harbor.

featured_experiences.name: Misty Fjords Floatplane Adventure
featured_experiences.note: Most popular Ketchikan excursion. De Havilland Beaver and Otter floatplanes. Weather dependent. Book early.

featured_experiences.name: Great Alaskan Lumberjack Show
featured_experiences.note: #1 rated attraction for first-time visitors. $37 adults. Multiple shows daily. Covered/heated seating. Steps from cruise terminal.

featured_experiences.name: Totem Poles & Native Culture Tour
featured_experiences.note: World's largest concentration of standing totem poles. Active carving demonstrations. Learn Tlingit, Haida, and Tsimshian traditions.

featured_experiences.name: Rainforest Canopy Zipline
featured_experiences.note: Fly through America's largest national forest. Rain or shine — embrace the 162 inches of annual rainfall!

featured_experiences.name: Bear Viewing at Neets Bay
featured_experiences.note: Ketchikan is one of the best places in Southeast Alaska to see black bears. July-September best for salmon runs.

featured_experiences.name: Creek Street Walking Tour
featured_experiences.note: Self-guided exploration of Ketchikan's most photographed area. Former red-light district, now charming shops and restaurants.
